intro: Symplocos fuscata, commonly known as black alder, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, red-brown berries that ripen in the fall. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland areas. Symplocos fuscata plays a role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
